thread.title: Wind gusts topping 60, 70, 80 and 90 miles per hour recorded in South Dakota Wednesday and Thursday
thread.title_full: Wind gusts topping 60, 70, 80 and 90 miles per hour recorded in South Dakota Wednesday and Thursday

author: DRG Media Group News
title: Wind gusts topping 60, 70, 80 and 90 miles per hour recorded in South Dakota Wednesday and Thursday
text:
A weather system blowing through the Midwest late Wednesday night into Thursday (Dec. 16-17, 2025), triggered high wind warnings, the closure of Interstate 29 from Canada to South Dakota because of blizzard conditions and a temporary suspension on the movement of oversize loads on state roadways.
Aberdeen National Weather Service Meteorologist Travis Tarver said the gusty wind will continue the rest of the day.
Tarver said the National Weather Service has clocked dozens of wind gusts at more than 80 mph.
The forecast is quite a bit different for Friday, with an expected high of 47Â°F, mainly cloudy skies and southeast winds at 10 to 15 mph.
To see a map of wind gusts and other weather reports, go to the National Weather Service website.
